Items.Item: Redo last change. Redo includes changes all changes done to data may it be through editor, batch process or changeing selected folder.
Undo last change. Undo includes changes all changes done to data may it be through editor, batch process or changeing selected folder.
Indicates ongoing filesystem operations that happen in the background.

The browser shows all mounted disks and folders. Selecting a folder with left mouse click loads contained MP3 files into the file list. A context menu offering rich batch commands opens on right mouse click.

The file list shows all MP3 files found in the selected folder. Files can be single- and multiselected. A combined view of all information found in the files is shown in the multi tag editor below. Double click on a file starts playback. Dropping Jpeg or PNG picture adds an album cover to each file.
The multi tag editor shows the combined information of all selected MP3 files. Information may be text, picture or binary. Text and pictures can be edited on a single file or all at once.

The multi tag view shows all information of a certain type from all selected MP3s. Editing modifies all frames in all selected MP3s. To see the individual per-file information, click the arrow to open details.
Shows a single piece of information of a certain type in a single MP3. Edits are only made to the owning file.
Save changes done. Changes include change of version, adding, removing and editing a frame.
Change the tag version of all selected MP3 files. As most spread and supported, version 2.3 is recommended.
Add a new type of information to the selected MP3 files.
Offers a simple view with only the main information. NOTE: Does not change the actual data.
Create/duplicate the the type of information so it is contained in each selected MP3 file. Useful for editing many files, starting with one and duplicating later.
Delete the type of information from all selected MP3 files.
Delete the single piece of information from the owning MP3 file.
Load an album cover from a picture on disc.
Save album cover as picture on disc.
Pause playback. Resume with pressing play.
Shows artist and title of the currently played MP3 file.
Shows the bitrate of the currently played MP3 file. For VBR, the actual bitrate maybe vary.
Shows position of played MP3 file in Hours:Minutes:Second.
The library shows all MP3 files found in your library folder. The folder is scanned in the background when the application starts or the library path is changed.
Search for words in all MP3 files found in your library. By default, the words are 'OR'-ed. Words enclosed by "" are 'AND'-ed.
Indicates if the library is currently refreshed in background.
The library folder is scanned in background for MP3 files that appear in the library tab. This folder also serves as target for the album to library command.
Chose preferred tag version. This version is used whenever the program attaches information to an MP3 file. As most spread and supported, version 2.3 is recommended.

Pattern that defines how filenames are created from tag information. Supported case-sensitive keywords are: 'Artist', 'Album', 'Title', 'TrackNumber', 'ReleaseYear', 'PartOfSet', 'ContentType', 'Composer', 'BandOrchestraAccompaniment', 'ConductorPerformer', 'InterpretedRemixedModified', 'Publisher' and 'Encoder'. Optional parts may be placed in curly brackets '{' and '}'. NOTE: The command only works on folders regarded as album.

Pattern that defines how foldernames are created from tag information. Supported case-sensitive keywords are: 'Artist', 'Album', 'Title', 'TrackNumber' and 'ReleaseYear'. Optional parts may be placed in curly brackets '{' and '}'. NOTE: The command only works on folders regarded as album.

Pattern how to create track numbers. The first digits define the track index. They MAYBE followed by a separator which then MUST be followed by digits for the number of tracks. The number of digits defines how many leading zeros are added to the numbers. E.g. pattern '0' on an album with two tracks would create the '1' for the first and '2' for the second track. The pattern '00/0' would create '01/2' for the first and '02/2' for the second.
Show/hide the help view this text is located in 8-)
Enable more detailed information shown in console for executed commands.
Choose what information must be in all MP3 files in a folder to be recognized as tagged album.
Set if the same artist name must be set in all files to be recognized as album.
Set if the same album name must be set in all files to be recognized as album.
Set if a title must be set in all files to be recognized as album.
Set if all files must have a unique tracknumber to be recognized as album.
Set if all files need to have a release year set to be recognized as album.
The minimum number of MP3 files required in a folder to be recognized as album.
The command works on folders and recursevily re-writes all MP3 files found. It combines several often used operations like text format correction and version conversion.
Remove whitespace from texts like ' FooBar ' to 'FooBar'.
Breaks CamelCase texts like 'FooBar' to 'Foo Bar'.
Breaks underscored texts like 'Foo_Bar' to 'Foo Bar'.
Changes the first letter of each word to upper case like 'foo bar' to 'Foo Bar'.
Words that should not be changed by the 'first char upper'-command. Instead, they are corrected.
Create a track number for each track. The track number is taken from the position of the file in the file list.
Deletes unwanted frames. Frames that should be not dropped can be marked below.
Set frames that should NOT be dropped. This list is per version!

Drop all tag codec information like used text encoding or unsynchronization. The information is re-written using the build-in default encodings. Litte-Endian Unicode and Utf-8 are built-in preferred text codecs.
Rename all files after preparse according to filename pattern.
Rename all folders after preparse according to foldername pattern.
Settings for internet queries creating tags.

If multiple choices are returned from an internet query, the heuristic helps to prevent false-positives when set to strict and accepts more if set to fuzzy. (Details: When set to strict, the file path is splitted into words where at least one word must match the results returned from Discogs. This prevents false positive tagging for duplicate disc IDs)
Extracts tag information like artist and title from filenames.

Pattern that defines how tag information MAYBE extracted from file names. Supported case-sensitive keywords are: 'Artist', 'Album', 'Title', 'TrackNumber', 'ReleaseYear', 'PartOfSet', 'ContentType', 'Composer', 'BandOrchestraAccompaniment', 'ConductorPerformer', 'InterpretedRemixedModified', 'Publisher' and 'Encoder'.

Copies or moves all albums found to the library folder. The library folder can be set-up in the preferences tab. NOTE: The command only works on folders regarded as album. A folder is regarded as album only if it fulfills all requirements set up in 'Album Recognition'.
Chose if a as album regarded folder is copied or moved into the library. A move deletes the source folder after copy.
Define what happens if the album already exists in library.
Searches folders for albums. An a folder is regarded as album if: 1) It contains at least three MP3 files. 2) All included files contain at least artist, album, title and track number information.
Re-writes all tag informations in all MP3 files found. It combines several often used operations. Detailed settings are offered in the preferences tab.

Queries internet database http://www.freedb.org to create tag informations like artist, album, title and release year from just the MP3s. For the command to work, all files of an CD are required in the order they were on CD.

Queries internet database http://www.discogs.com to create tag informations like artist, album, title, release year and cover art from the 'pre-tagged' MP3s. For the command to work, all files MUST have artist and album name set. The information from Discogs is well maintained but for finding hits, the artist and album name must exactly match the entries in the Discogs database. Quering Discogs might be quite slow.

Queries internet database http://www.musicbrainz.org to create tag informations like artist, album, title and release year from the 'pre-tagged' MP3s. For the command to work, all files MUST have artist and album name set. Quering MusicBrainz might be quite slow but also produces good results if artist or album name do not match the exactly.

Searches for album cover and store in MP3 files. The covers are search using google image search. The first result of five is taken if it meets the following criterias: 1) JPG or PNG. 2) the file is bigger than 6kB. 3) The difference of width and height may not be bigger than 10%. 4) The server anwers the download request.
Extracts tag information like artist and title from filenames. The rules can be define in the preferences tab.

Changes filenames according to tag information like artist and title. The rules can be define in the preferences tab. NOTE: The command only works on folders regarded as album. A folder is regarded as album only if: 1) It contains at least three files. 2) All included files contain at least artist, album, title and track number information.

Changes folder name according to tag information in contained MP3 files. The rules can be define in the preferences tab. NOTE: The command only works on folders regarded as album. A folder is regarded as album only if: 1) It contains at least three files. 2) All included files contain at least artist, album, title and track number information.

Copies or moves all albums found to the library folder. The library folder can be set-up in the preferences tab. NOTE: The command only works on folders regarded as album. A folder is regarded as album only if: 1) It contains at least three files. 2) All included files contain at least artist, album, title and track number information.
Tries to query wikipedia about the folder name.
Moves the folder to the program internal recycle which allows to undo the operation. The recycle is cleared when closing the program.
